title: 112_hr4373
content: The Act may be cited as the "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" and includes expanded tax benefits for adoption made permanent. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" made expansions enacted in 2001 permanent and reinstated expansions enacted in 2010, including an increase in the dollar limitation for adoption credits. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" increased the dollar limitation for adoption credits from $10,000 to $13,170, with adjustments for inflation starting in 2010. The dollar amount for adoption credits was increased from $10,000 to $13,170 under the "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012", with adjustments for inflation starting in 2010. If the increased amount is not a multiple of $10, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" increased the adoption credit from $10,000 to $13,170, with adjustments for inflation starting in 2010. The adoption credit amounts in subsections (a)(2) and (b)(1) are increased annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins. Any increased amount not a multiple of $10 is rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. Additionally, the income limitation in subsection (b)(2)(A) is also adjusted annually based on the same cost-of-living adjustment. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to make the adoption credit refundable and move it to a different subpart. Conforming amendments are made to other sections of the Code. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to make changes to various sections, including striking certain references to section 23 and redesignating section 36C. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to make changes to various sections, including striking references to section 23 and inserting section 36C in multiple subsections. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking the item relating to section 23 and inserting section 36C in multiple subsections. The amendments made by section 36C relate to adoption expenses and are effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2011.
